page.title: 16INTERVIEW WITH FISHERMAN
page.content: Being a fisherman leaves you with some fond memories as it is a dangerous but exciting life.Some memorable things for him included large catches and the arrival of the new lifeboat.The sea at Cullercoats Bay is at its calmest from 12:00pm to 1:00am.The main natural features that hinder the work include tides and currents. From his point of view the best thing about being a fisherman is the knowledge he has gained and the excitment,and the few bad points are mainly the bad hours he has to work. He has performed many dangerous rescues in his time as a member of the lifeboat.Cullercoats was once a main fishing port but now the boats have increased in size and decreased in numbers.Even though Cullercoats has changed he is still proud to be a Cullercoats boy.
